\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{usage:installation}}\label{\detokenize{usage::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
When the DDS is in production, you \sphinxstylestrong{will be} able to install it using pip:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZdl{} }pip install dds
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Commands}
\label{\detokenize{usage:commands}}

\subsection{dds}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
SciLifeLab Data Delivery System (DDS) command line interface.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Access token is saved in a .dds\_cli\_token file in the home directory.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]} COMMAND \PYG{o}{[}ARGS\PYG{o}{]}...
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsubsection{auth}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds-auth}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Manage the saved authentication token.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds auth \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]} COMMAND \PYG{o}{[}ARGS\PYG{o}{]}...
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\paragraph{info}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds-auth-info}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Print info on saved authentication token validity and age.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds auth info \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\paragraph{login}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds-auth-login}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Renew the authentication token stored in the ‘.dds\_cli\_token’ file.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Run this command before running the cli in a non interactive fashion as this enables the longest
possible session time before a password needs to be entered again.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds auth login \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\subsubsection*{Options}
\index{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option}!\sphinxhyphen{}u@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}u}}\index{\sphinxhyphen{}u@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}u}!dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option}}\index{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option}!\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}username \textless{}username\textgreater{}@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}username \textless{}username\textgreater{}}}\index{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}username \textless{}username\textgreater{}@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}username \textless{}username\textgreater{}}!dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}auth\sphinxhyphen{}login command line option}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{usage:cmdoption-dds-auth-login-u}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}u}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{,~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}username}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{~\textless{}username\textgreater{}}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Your Data Delivery System username. Required unless the \sphinxtitleref{\textendash{}check} flag is used.

\end{fulllineitems}



\paragraph{logout}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds-auth-logout}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Remove the saved authentication token by deleting the ‘.dds\_cli\_token’ file.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds auth \PYG{n+nb}{logout} \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsubsection{ls}
\label{\detokenize{usage:dds-ls}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
List your projects and project files.

\sphinxAtStartPar
To list all projects, run \sphinxtitleref{dds ls} without any arguments.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Specify a Project ID to list the files within a project.
You can also follow this with a subfolder path to show files within that folder.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
dds ls \PYG{o}{[}OPTIONS\PYG{o}{]} \PYG{o}{[}PROJECT ID\PYG{o}{]} \PYG{o}{[}FOLDER\PYG{o}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\index{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}!\sphinxhyphen{}lp@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}lp}}\index{\sphinxhyphen{}lp@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}lp}!dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}}\index{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}!\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}projects@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}projects}}\index{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}projects@\spxentry{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}projects}!dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
List all project connected to your account.

\subsubsection*{Arguments}
\index{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}!{[}PROJECT ID{]}@\spxentry{{[}PROJECT ID{]}}}\index{{[}PROJECT ID{]}@\spxentry{{[}PROJECT ID{]}}!dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option@\spxentry{dds\sphinxhyphen{}ls command line option}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{usage:cmdoption-dds-ls-arg-PROJECT}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}PROJECT}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{~ID{]}}}}

\index{token\_expired() (dds\_cli.user.TokenFile method)@\spxentry{token\_expired()}\spxextra{dds\_cli.user.TokenFile method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{dds_cli:dds_cli.user.TokenFile.token_expired}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{token\_expired}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check how old the token is based on the modification time of the token file.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It compares the age with the dds variables TOKEN\_MAX\_AGE and TOKEN\_WARNING\_AGE to decide
what to do.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns True if the token has expired, False otherwise.

\sphinxAtStartPar
** Notice, this does not actually know the expiration time of the token, it’s possible that the
expiration time has changed upstream in which case the variables need to be updated.

\sphinxAtStartPar
if check is True, token age will be reported to stdout

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}
